title.narrative: WASH OP 2 CLIMATE CHANGE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE

description.narrative: By 2023 the Government and its partners have capacity to implement risk-Informed approaches that strengthen resilience to climate change and lead Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) preparedness and response to humanitarian crisis, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale
